did.abstract: Dominic J. Perrone Jr. was a prominent business man and Democrat politician in Ionia County, Michigan in the 1950s. He was an active member of the Ionia Public Board of Education and served for 16 years on the board. The collection contains files relating to his political career and businesses, his personal diaries, and photographs.

bioghist.p: Dominic Joseph Perrone Jr. was born in Johnsonburg, Pennsylvania on June 3, 1909. Perrone owned and operated a store and soda fountain in Ionia, Michigan with his wife Margaret Perrone and published a small newspaper called The News Stand . His political career began in 1949 when he announced his candidacy for Mayor of Ionia, though he would later drop out of the race. Perrone served on the Ionia Public Board of Education for 16 years. He ran on the democratic ticket for the state representative for Ionia in 1954, 1956, and 1958. In 1954 Perrone opened the Nix Distribution Company as a wholesale beer and wine distributor for Ionia and Montcalm counties. He was also a member of the Ionia County Memorial Hospital Board of Trustees, Ionian Lions Club, Ionia Elks, Rotary and Travelers Protective Association. Perrone died in 2004 and is buried in Ionia, Michigan.

arrangement.p: The collection is divided into two series: Personal and Business Materials and Political Materials.

scopecontent.p: The papers of Dominic Joseph Perrone Jr. reflect Perrone's growth as a newsboy to a prominent business man and politician in Ionia County, Michigan. The papers date from 1927 to 1987.

The Personal and Business Materials series, 1927-1942, primarily covers the period before his mayoral run in 1949. His diaries detail his day to day activities starting in 1927 and ending in 1945. Of interest is a letter written by his son Michael regarding his experience in the Vietnam War. Included are a number of newspapers relating to his business ventures and several photographs of Perrone.

The Political Materials, 1949-1956, provide a wealth of information regarding Ionia politics during the 1950s. It includes information regarding his run for mayoral office, the Ionia Public Board of Education, and his attempts for state office.
